reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here for a night after attending a birthday celebration at the Suite Bar across the street. It was comfortable and well priced. I would recommend it as a good base to explore the city.
reviews.title: Good location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had two nights in a one-bedroom suite which was very spacious and met all our needs. On the first floor, we had no more than a glimpse of the Waitemata Harbour, but the hotel is so close to all Auckland has to offer, we weren't there to see the view anyway. Only a matter of minutes walk from The Viaduct, Prince's and Queen's Wharves, five minutes to Queen Street, the Downtown Shopping Complex and Britomart Transport Centre, this hotel is ideally placed to reach any of these destinations quickly and easily. Very friendly and helpful staff, lovely super king bed, windows galore, very adequate kitchen and bathroom facilities, I would recommend the Grand Chancellor to all.
reviews.title: Very comfortable suite, handy to everything

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hi. I've never written a review until now. I was charged $60 for a stain on the carpet in my room that I did not do. My wife & I are tidy people and look after our hotel rooms well. If you want to find extra charges on your credit card for things you did not do then stay here!
reviews.title: Blatantly Ripped Off!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Having had the worst accommodation experience 30mins before, a bed was all we were after. Arrived very tired and short of money, the staff member asked to put down a $250 bond. I told him i couldn't afford it and he said i could just pay what i could. The room was clean and tidy. And rather large. It had a nice kitchenette and a welcoming bathroom with a powerful shower. It was a good room but definitely nothing flash. The curtains were rather in-effective due to how thin they were so let through a lot of light early in the morning. Road works in the morning also helped an early rise. Friendly staff although slightly serious. Overall a pleasant place to stay.
reviews.title: For an emergency room, very good

reviews.text: Good location and great view from our two bedroom apartment. Staff were very friendly. This was clearly a building built to a budget and it shows. The rooms have not aged well.
reviews.title: Good location and view. Tired decor.

reviews.text: I had a fantastic time here I couldn't get over how friendly everyone was from the cleaners to the Management everyone was so helpful in every way. The front desk was always friendly, the chef is fantastic so don't be put of by the size of the restaurant the fare was as good as anywhere. Harry at the bar was always ready to replenish our drinks. Location was superb with only a short walk to the action on the Viaduct.
reviews.title: My Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If your thinking of staying here do it
reviews.title: Very tired and dirty

reviews.text: We had a one bedroom apartment on the first floor. I had read some Ok reviews about this property but was very disappointed. The rooms were very badly laid out, light switches were in very unusual places, no bedside lights in the bedroom, no light switches near the bed. The bedroom was very small and no room for two people to have luggage.
reviews.title: Great central quality accommodation

reviews.text: The carpet in the lounge area was disgustingly stained.
reviews.title: Basic facilities in a good location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Would never go back.
reviews.title: Short Stay in Auckland

reviews.text: Great location loved the Japanese teppanyaki restaurant lovely birthday celebration!
reviews.title: Feel spoilt!

reviews.text: Three sisters up to ronan had a two bedroom apartment for weekend was fantastic large clean great veiws will stay again
reviews.title: Fab place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I had just arrived after a twelve night cruise from Sydney, Australia. By the time the cruise had finished all I wanted to do was go home to UK. As the hotel was just a few blocks from the Port we decided to walk up to the hotel. Arriving early we had to leave our suitcases in the baggage room and walk about for about three hours on a public holiday. On returning to the hotel we were able to check in earlier and on arriving at our accommodations we were very pleasantly surprised. A suite had been booked which sounded very grand and we had two rooms; one a double bedroom and a sitting room with a sofa and armchair, a refridgerator, two hotplates, a dishwasher and basin. There was ample cutlery and plates for up to four people. We were able, therefore, to prepare our own breakfasts and have supper as appropriate. What might have turned out to be a "drag" actually was a very pleasant stay and the staff in reception were extremely helpful.
reviews.title: Pleasant Accommodation at a Great Location

reviews.text: We had a vrey pleasant stay at this establishment and if we travelled to Auckland again would make a point of trying to stay here.
reviews.title: Perfect for a business trip

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is situated close to the Port and all the ample amenities afforded by this downtown location.
reviews.title: Long story short: A ruined evening.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were greeted by a very friendly young woman..zohee. We booked through wotif and paid for a studio room .. got an upgrade to a 1 bedroom suite. Our room... which was on the first floor was clean and roomy. We had 2 double beds in bedroom and a very comfortable couch and chair in kitchen/ dining area. Loved the full length mirror in the bedroom. We have stayed at 4 star hotels and the only mirrors have been in the bathroom.. The same woman was on duty when we left and was very pleasant. Would stay there again.
reviews.title: Good location Friendly service

reviews.text: We booked a 2 bedroom, non smoking apartment in New Years Eve in order to celebration at the Viaduct. Upon checked in we found the room stink of cigarette smell. We called the reception to complaint about the smell and requested to change to a different room, but was told the hotel is fully booked; and said the room is smoke-free room (which clearly wasn't). The furnitures in the room are extremely tired, the coffee table has lots of greasy finger marks on it, the round dinning table has uneven legs, the back of the chairs showing cracks on them and the balcany furniture is old and dusty with burnt cigarette marks on the table. The sofa and carpet also have lots of stains and just look so tired and dirty. For the price they charge (NZ$500 a night + 1.5% credit card fee) I am sure there are much better place to stay in Auckland.
reviews.title: Tired and dirty

reviews.text: This is a fantastic location. 5 minute walk to the shops, 5 minute walk to the Viaduct with it's restaurants and bars but otherwise it's very tired. Make sure you get a harbour side room and also something high up. The traffic on the city side (Hobson St) is like the Grand Prix in the morning! The rooms are clean and comfortable but need new carpet and a coat of paint. The balcony furniture should just go to the tip. The restaurant is OK in the evening but the cooked breakfast in the morning is ordinary - take a tip and head for Ronnies Cafe just along the road. OK for me for a business trip but 3 stars tops so don't expect the wife to be impressed.
reviews.title: Location, location, location but that's pretty much it

reviews.text: We booked via an iSite location.
reviews.title: Not what we expected

reviews.text: Upon arrival at reception with our 22month old daughter in tow, we were disappointed with the service. When we asked for the use of a trolley for our gear... when it arrived it was put near us and then the porter/staff member walked away - no offer of assistance or even acknowledgment.
reviews.title: Excellent location
